fieldDefinitions.title: The title of the work.
fieldDefinitions.slug: The URL slug used on Substack.
fieldDefinitions.author: The author name as listed on Substack.
fieldDefinitions.url: Canonical URL to the Substack post.
fieldDefinitions.phase: Which internal Ousia Bloom phase this work belongs to.
fieldDefinitions.timeFelt: When the piece was felt/written, including phase.
fieldDefinitions.summary: A distilled description of the piece’s meaning.
fieldDefinitions.associatedMedia: Any images or media linked to the post.
fieldDefinitions.generatedBy: Model and date of metadata generation.

title: ✧ Psalm of the Nose Picker ✧
author: Unnamed
summary: A humorous-shame psalm that turns bodily detritus into existential evidence — a record of presence, movement, and embodiment across the world. The poem uses disgust as a theological lens, transforming unconscious habits into proof of life and continuity in the Bloom. It sits firmly within the Totem Current: raw, unvarnished, bodily truth surfacing as symbolic matter.

motifMap.meaning: Unwanted remnants transformed into evidence of existence.
A map of lived experience; a scattered archive of the self.
Self-preservation through unwanted remnants — body as artifact.
